10984204Di2015UniqueSeparatorpublic static string RtfToHtml(string rtfText)Di2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    if (String.IsNullOrEmpty(rtfText)) return rtfText;Di2015NewLine    if (!rtfText.Contains(@"{\\rtf1")) return rtfText.Replace("\\r\\n", "<br>").Replace("\\r", "<br>");Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    Converter converter = new Converter();Di2015NewLine    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(converter.ConvertRtfToHtml(rtfText));Di2015NewLine    string html = Regex.Replace(sb.ToString(), @"font-size:(\\d*(\\.\\d+)?);", @"font-size:$1pt;");Di2015NewLine    tryDi2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        HtmlAgilityPack.HtmlDocument doc = new HtmlAgilityPack.HtmlDocument();Di2015NewLine        doc.LoadHtml(html);Di2015NewLine        RemoveStyleTags(doc, "ol");Di2015NewLine        RemoveStyleTags(doc, "ul");Di2015NewLine        RemoveStyleTags(doc, "li");Di2015NewLine        return doc.DocumentNode.InnerHtml;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine    catch { }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    return html;Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine

10984590Di2015UniqueSeparatorprivate void SampleSolution(DataTable dt1, DataTable dt2)Di2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    //If you have primary keys:Di2015NewLine    var results = from table1 in dt1.AsEnumerable()Di2015NewLine                    join table2 in dt2.AsEnumerable() on table1.Field<int>("id") equals table2.Field<int>("id")Di2015NewLine                    where table1.Field<int>("ColumnA") != table2.Field<int>("ColumnA") || table1.Field<int>("ColumnB") != table2.Field<int>("ColumnB") || table1.Field<String>("ColumnC") != table2.Field<String>("ColumnC")Di2015NewLine                    select table1;Di2015NewLine    //This will give you the rows in dt1 which do not match the rows in dt2.  You will need to expand the where clause to include all your columns.Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    //If you do not have primarry keys then you will need to match up each column and then find the missing.Di2015NewLine    var matched = from table1 in dt1.AsEnumerable()Di2015NewLine                    join table2 in dt2.AsEnumerable() on table1.Field<int>("ColumnA") equals table2.Field<int>("ColumnA")Di2015NewLine                    where table1.Field<int>("ColumnB") == table2.Field<int>("ColumnB") || table1.Field<string>("ColumnC") == table2.Field<string>("ColumnC") || table1.Field<object>("ColumnD") == table2.Field<object>("ColumnD")Di2015NewLine                    select table1;Di2015NewLine    var missing = from table1 in dt1.AsEnumerable()Di2015NewLine                    where !matched.Contains(table1)Di2015NewLine                    select table1;Di2015NewLine    //This should give you the rows which do not have a match.  You will need to expand the where clause to include all your columns.Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine

MyGetDefaultWebHttpBehavior : WebHttpBehaviorDi2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        public override void ApplyDispatchBehavior(ServiceEndpoint endpoint, EndpointDispatcher endpointDispatcher)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            foreach (var operation in endpoint.Contract.Operations)Di2015NewLine            {Di2015NewLine                if (operation.Behaviors.Find<WebGetAttribute>() == null && operation.Behaviors.Find<WebInvokeAttribute>() == null)Di2015NewLine                {Di2015NewLine                    operation.Behaviors.Add(new WebGetAttribute());Di2015NewLine                }Di2015NewLine            }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine            base.ApplyDispatchBehavior(endpoint, endpointDispatcher);Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine    public static void Test()Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        string baseAddress = "http://" + Environment.MachineName + ":8000/Service";Di2015NewLine        ServiceHost host = new ServiceHost(typeof(Service), new Uri(baseAddress));Di2015NewLine        host.AddServiceEndpoint(typeof(Service), new WebHttpBinding(), "").Behaviors.Add(new MyGetDefaultWebHttpBehavior());Di2015NewLine        host.Open();Di2015NewLine        Console.WriteLine("Host opened");Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine        WebClient c = new 10986550Di2015UniqueSeparatorCREATE FUNCTION dbo.SplitStringsDi2015NewLine(Di2015NewLine    @List       NVARCHAR(MAX),Di2015NewLine    @Delimiter  NVARCHAR(255)Di2015NewLine)Di2015NewLineRETURNS TABLEDi2015NewLineASDi2015NewLine    RETURN (SELECT Number = ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY Number),Di2015NewLine        Item FROM (SELECT Number, Item = LTRIM(RTRIM(SUBSTRING(@List, Number, Di2015NewLine        CHARINDEX(@Delimiter, @List + @Delimiter, Number) - Number)))Di2015NewLine    FROM (SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY [object_id])Di2015NewLine        FROM sys.all_objects) AS n(Number)Di2015NewLine    WHERE Number <= CONVERT(INT, LEN(@List))Di2015NewLine        AND SUBSTRING(@Delimiter + @List, Number, 1) = @DelimiterDi2015NewLine    ) AS y);Di2015NewLineGODi2015NewLine
10986550Di2015UniqueSeparatorDECLARE @x NVARCHAR(MAX); -- a parameter to your stored procedureDi2015NewLineDi2015NewLineSET @x = N'foo, 20120101, 26; bar, 20120612, 32';Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine;WITH x AS Di2015NewLine(Di2015NewLine    SELECT ID = s.Number, InnerID = y.Number, y.Item Di2015NewLine    -- parameter and "row" delimiter here:Di2015NewLine    FROM dbo.SplitStrings(@x, ';') AS sDi2015NewLine    -- output and "column" delimiter here:Di2015NewLine    CROSS APPLY dbo.SplitStrings(s.Item, ',') AS yDi2015NewLine)Di2015NewLineSELECT Di2015NewLine    prop1 = x.Item, Di2015NewLine    prop2 = x2.Item, Di2015NewLine    prop3 = x3.ItemDi2015NewLineFROM x Di2015NewLineINNER JOIN x AS x2 Di2015NewLineON x.InnerID = x2.InnerID - 1Di2015NewLineAND x.ID = x2.IDDi2015NewLineINNER JOIN x AS x3Di2015NewLineON x2.InnerID = x3.InnerID - 1Di2015NewLineAND x2.ID = x3.IDDi2015NewLineWHERE x.InnerID = 1Di2015NewLineORDER BY x.ID;Di2015NewLine

10988051Di2015UniqueSeparatorclass GridDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    readonly int _rowCount;Di2015NewLine    readonly int _columnCount;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    // Insert data for master list of obstructed cellsDi2015NewLine    // or master list of unobstructed cellsDi2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public Node GetNode(int row, int column)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        if (IsOnGrid(row, column) && !IsObstructed(row, column))Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return new Node(this, row, column);Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine        return null;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    private bool IsOnGrid(int row, int column)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        return row >= 0 && row < _rowCount && column >= 0 && column < _columnCount;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    private bool IsObstructed(int row, int column)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        // Insert code to check whether specified row and column is obstructedDi2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLineclass Node : IHasNeighbours<Node>Di2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    readonly Grid _grid;Di2015NewLine    readonly int _row;Di2015NewLine    readonly int _column;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public Node(Grid grid, int row, int column)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        _grid = grid;Di2015NewLine        _row = row;Di2015NewLine        _column = column;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public Node UpDi2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        getDi2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return _grid.GetNode(_row - 1, _column);Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public Node DownDi2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        getDi2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return _grid.GetNode(_row + 1,_column);Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public Node LeftDi2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        getDi2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return _grid.GetNode(_row, _column - 1);Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public Node RightDi2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        getDi2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return _grid.GetNode(_row, _column + 1);Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public IEnumerable<Node> NeighboursDi2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        getDi2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            Node[] neighbors = new Node[] {Up, Down, Left, Right};Di2015NewLine            foreach (Node neighbor in neighbors)Di2015NewLine            {Di2015NewLine                if (neighbor != null)Di2015NewLine                {Di2015NewLine                    yield return neighbor;Di2015NewLine                }Di2015NewLine            }Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine

10988793Di2015UniqueSeparator//So you have a character...Di2015NewLinepublic class CharacterDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    //You know you ALWAYS need Raw Attribs in a gameDi2015NewLine    private Dictionary<string, Attrib> _rawAttributes;Di2015NewLine    //You know you will always need a record of modified attribsDi2015NewLine    private Dictionary<string, Attrib> _modifiedAttributes;Di2015NewLine    //And while your at it, take a light optimization to not have to recalculate everytimeDi2015NewLine    private bool _areModifiedAttribsCurrent { get; set; }Di2015NewLine    //A character has gear! This is what makes the world go aroundDi2015NewLine    public List<Equipment> Equipment { get; private set; }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    //You don't want to give public access to setting gear, this should be controlled.Di2015NewLine    //You'll want to do more as far as remove / change... but this'll get you startedDi2015NewLine    public void AddEquipment(Equipment e)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        Equipment.Add(e);Di2015NewLine        _areModifiedAttribsCurrent = false;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    //And a way to add attribs and set base values..Di2015NewLine    //once again, you will want more but this will get you startedDi2015NewLine    public void AddAttribute(Attrib x)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        _rawAttributes.Add(x.Name, x);Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    //Finally you want a way to fetch the modified attribsDi2015NewLine    //Keep in mind you need to do the copy dance in the  apply to not upset your Di2015NewLine    //base stats.Di2015NewLine    public Dictionary<string, Attrib> FetchModifiedAttributes()Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        if (!_areModifiedAttribsCurrent)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            var traceAttribs = _rawAttributes;Di2015NewLine            foreach (var e in Equipment.OrderBy(x => x.ApplyOrder))Di2015NewLine            {Di2015NewLine                traceAttribs = e.ApplyModifiers(traceAttribs);Di2015NewLine            }Di2015NewLine            _modifiedAttributes = traceAttribs;Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine        return _modifiedAttributes;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine//Attrib, pretty simple.. Could go away but we all know attribs have effects so don't even start down that pathDi2015NewLine//You WILL need this class later on... but right now it looks pretty meaningless.Di2015NewLinepublic class AttribDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    public string Name { get; set; }Di2015NewLine    public decimal Value { get; set; }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine//GEAR... yes, this is what all RPG lovers love... Di2015NewLine//Grind for that awesome gear!Di2015NewLinepublic class EquipmentDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    //Ok so I put in some stuff unrelated to your problem but you need a name right?!Di2015NewLine    public string Name { get; set; }Di2015NewLine    //What order does gear effect stats... this is important if you do more than flat modifiers.Di2015NewLine    public int ApplyOrder { get; set; }Di2015NewLine    //What modifiers does this gear have?!Di2015NewLine    public List<Modifier> ItemModifiers { get; set; }Di2015NewLine    //Aha.... let the gear apply its modifiers to an attrib dictionary... I knew I loved OO for some reasonDi2015NewLine    public Dictionary<string, Attrib> ApplyModifiers(Dictionary<string, Attrib> inParams)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        //Copy / Clone... Whatever you want to call it this is important as to not Di2015NewLine        //unintentionally screw up yoru base collection.Di2015NewLine        var response = new Dictionary<string, Attrib>();Di2015NewLine        foreach (var m in ItemModifiers)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            //If we have this attrib, keep goingDi2015NewLine            if (inParams.ContainsKey(m.TargetName))Di2015NewLine            {Di2015NewLine                //If this is the first time the response ran into it, add itDi2015NewLine                if (!response.ContainsKey(m.TargetName))Di2015NewLine                {Di2015NewLine                    response.Add(m.TargetName, inParams[m.TargetName]);Di2015NewLine                }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine                //And wait what's this... let the Modifier apply it!?  Di2015NewLine                //yes... pass it down again... you'll see why in a second.Di2015NewLine                m.Apply(response[m.TargetName]);Di2015NewLine            }Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine        return response;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine//A modifier... what the!?Di2015NewLine//Yep... abstraction is key to maintainable and expandable codeDi2015NewLinepublic class ModifierDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    public string TargetName { get; set; }Di2015NewLine    public decimal ModifierValue { get; set; }Di2015NewLine    //The other stuff is kind of pointless... but this is where the magic happens... All in a modifier type.Di2015NewLine    public ModifierType ModifierType { get; set; }Di2015NewLine    //Let the modifier apply it's own values... off the type... yeaDi2015NewLine    //I did that on purpose ;-)Di2015NewLine    public void Apply(Attrib a)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        a.Value = ModifierType.ApplyModifier(this, a.Value);Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine//Decoration... WonderfulDi2015NewLine//This base class gives you a interface to work with... Hell, it could be an interface but I decidedDi2015NewLine//to type abstract today.Di2015NewLinepublic abstract class ModifierTypeDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    public abstract string ModifierName { get; }Di2015NewLine    public abstract decimal ApplyModifier(Modifier m, decimal InitialValue);Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine//A concrete type of ModifierType... This is what determines how the modifier value is applied.Di2015NewLine//This gives you more flexibility than hard coding modifier types.  If you really wanted to you couldDi2015NewLine//serialize these and store lambda expressions in the DB so you not only have type driven logic, you could haveDi2015NewLine//data driven behavior.Di2015NewLinepublic class FlatModifier : ModifierTypeDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    //The names can be really handy if you want to expose calculations to players.Di2015NewLine    public override string ModifierName { get { return "Flat Effect"; } }Di2015NewLine    //And finally... let the calculation happen!  Time to bubble back up!Di2015NewLine    public override decimal ApplyModifier(Modifier m, decimal InitialValue)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        return InitialValue + m.ModifierValue;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine
10988898Di2015UniqueSeparatorpublic sealed partial class CDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    string _t;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    class NDi2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        readonly C outer;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine        public N(C parent) { outer = parent; }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine        void m()Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            outer._t = "fie"; // Error is goneDi2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine

10989854Di2015UniqueSeparatorpublic class OrderDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    ...Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    private static Dictionary<int, Order> _orders = new Dictionary<int, Order>();Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public static Order Get(int id)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        return this._order[id];Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    private static object _idLocker = new object();Di2015NewLine    private static int _nextId = 0;Di2015NewLine    public readonly int Id;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public Order()Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        // Just to make sure that the identifiers are unique,Di2015NewLine        // even if you have threads messing around.Di2015NewLine        lock (_idLocker)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            this.Id = _nextId;Di2015NewLine            _nextId++;Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine        _orders.Add(this.Id, this);Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public Order(int id)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        this.Id = id;Di2015NewLine        _orders.Add(this.Id, this);Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public static bool Equals(int id1, int id2)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        return _orders[id1].Equals(_orders[id2]);Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public bool Equals(Order otherOrder)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        // Check whether you have the same inner state as the other orderDi2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine

10997393Di2015UniqueSeparatorpublic virtual Int32 CompareTo(Person person2)Di2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    Stack<Person> parents1 = GetParents(this);Di2015NewLine    Stack<Person> parents2 = GetParents(person2);Di2015NewLine    foreach (Person parent1 in parents1)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        Person parent2 = parents2.Pop();Di2015NewLine        // These two persons have the same parent tree:Di2015NewLine        // Compare their idsDi2015NewLine        if (parent1 == null && parent2 == null)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return 0;Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine        // 'this' person's parent tree is contained in person2's:Di2015NewLine        // 'this' must be a parent of person2Di2015NewLine        else if (parent1 == null)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return -1;Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine        // 'this' person's parent tree contains person2's:Di2015NewLine        // 'this' must be a child of person2Di2015NewLine        else if (parent2 == null)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return 1;Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine        // So far, both parent trees are the same sizeDi2015NewLine        // Compare the ids of each parent.Di2015NewLine        // If they are the same, go down another level.Di2015NewLine        elseDi2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            int comparison = parent1.id.CompareTo(parent2.id);Di2015NewLine            if (comparison != 0)Di2015NewLine            {Di2015NewLine                return comparison;Di2015NewLine            }Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine    // We should never get here anymore, but if we do,Di2015NewLine    // these are the same PersonDi2015NewLine    return 0;Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLinepublic static Stack<Person> GetParents(Person p)Di2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    Stack<Person> parents = new Stack<Person>();Di2015NewLine    // Add a null so that we don't have to checkDi2015NewLine    // if the stack is empty before popping.Di2015NewLine    parents.Push(null);Di2015NewLine    Person parent = p;Di2015NewLine    // Recurse through tree to rootDi2015NewLine    while (parent != null)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        parents.Push(parent);Di2015NewLine        parent = parent.Parent;Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine    return parents;Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine

10997862Di2015UniqueSeparatorpublic static class ProcessExtensions {Di2015NewLineprivate static string FindIndexedProcessName(int pid) {Di2015NewLine    var processName = Process.GetProcessById(pid).ProcessName;Di2015NewLine    var processesByName = Process.GetProcessesByName(processName);Di2015NewLine    string processIndexdName = null;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    for (var index = 0; index < processesByName.Length; index++) {Di2015NewLine        processIndexdName = index == 0 ? processName : processName + "#" + index;Di2015NewLine        var processId = new PerformanceCounter("Process", "ID Process", processIndexdName);Di2015NewLine        if ((int) processId.NextValue() == pid) {Di2015NewLine            return processIndexdName;Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    return processIndexdName;Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLineprivate static Process FindPidFromIndexedProcessName(string indexedProcessName) {Di2015NewLine    var parentId = new PerformanceCounter("Process", "Creating Process ID", indexedProcessName);Di2015NewLine    return Process.GetProcessById((int) parentId.NextValue());Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLinepublic static Process Parent(this Process process) {Di2015NewLine    return FindPidFromIndexedProcessName(FindIndexedProcessName(process.Id));Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine

10998159Di2015UniqueSeparatorvar pluginStates = new Dictionary<string, IDictionary<string, object>>();Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLinevar dictProjectState = jsonSerializer.Deserialize(reader) as Dictionary<string, object>;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLineforeach(var projectStatePair in dictProjectState)Di2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    string pluginKey = projectStatePair.Key;Di2015NewLine    var pluginValues = new Dictionary<string, object>();Di2015NewLine    object[] arrayDictHolder = projectStatePair.Value as object[];Di2015NewLine    var dictJsonRep = arrayDictHolder[0] as Dictionary<string, object>;Di2015NewLine    var dictObjRep =  arrayDictHolder[1] as Dictionary<string, object>;Di2015NewLine    foreach(var JsonRepPair in dictJsonRep)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        string jsonRepresentation = JsonRepPair.Value;Di2015NewLine        // We know both dictionaries have the same keys, soDi2015NewLine        // get the objType for this JsonRepresentationDi2015NewLine        object objType = dictObjRep[JsonRepPair.Key];Di2015NewLine        // Since you're serializing objType to a string, you'll needDi2015NewLine        // to get the actual Type before calling DeserializeObject.Di2015NewLine        Type jsonType = System.Type.GetType(objType as string);Di2015NewLine        object value = JsonConvert.DeserializeObject( jsonRepresentation, jsonType );Di2015NewLine        pluginValues.Add( JsonRepPair.Key );Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine    pluginStates.Add( pluginKey, pluginValues );Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine

11000777Di2015UniqueSeparator    /// <summary>Di2015NewLine    /// Adds the supplied user into the (local) groupDi2015NewLine    /// </summary>Di2015NewLine    /// <param name="userName">the full username (including domain)</param>Di2015NewLine    /// <param name="groupName">the name of the group</param>Di2015NewLine    /// <returns>true on success; Di2015NewLine    /// false if the group does not exist, or if the user is already in the group, or if the user cannont be added to the group</returns>Di2015NewLine    public static bool AddUserToLocalGroup(string userName, string groupName)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        DirectoryEntry userGroup = null;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine        tryDi2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            string groupPath = String.Format(CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture, "WinNT://{0}/{1},group", Environment.MachineName, groupName);Di2015NewLine            userGroup = new DirectoryEntry(groupPath);Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine            if ((null == userGroup) || (true == String.IsNullOrEmpty(userGroup.SchemaClassName)) || (0 != String.Compare(userGroup.SchemaClassName, "group", true, CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture)))Di2015NewLine                return false;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine            String userPath = String.Format(CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture, "WinNT://{0},user", userName);Di2015NewLine            userGroup.Invoke("Add", new object[] { userPath });Di2015NewLine            userGroup.CommitChanges();Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine            return true;Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine        catch (Exception)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            return false;Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine        finallyDi2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            if (null != userGroup) userGroup.Dispose();Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine

11007437Di2015UniqueSeparatorSend()
11007437Di2015UniqueSeparatorpublic void SendMessage(string message)Di2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    var data = Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes(message);Di2015NewLine    if (data.Length > byte.MaxValue) throw new Exception("Data exceeds maximum size");Di2015NewLine    var bufferList = new[]Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        new ArraySegment<byte>(new[] {(byte) data.Length}),Di2015NewLine        new ArraySegment<byte>(data)Di2015NewLine    };Di2015NewLine    ClientSocket.Send(bufferList);Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine
11007437Di2015UniqueSeparatorpublic string ReadMessage()Di2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    var header = new byte[1];Di2015NewLine    // Read the header indicating the data lengthDi2015NewLine    var bytesRead = ServerSocket.Receive(header);Di2015NewLine    if (bytesRead > 0)Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        var dataLength = header[0];Di2015NewLine        // If the message size is zero, return an empty stringDi2015NewLine        if (dataLength == 0) return string.Empty;Di2015NewLine        var buffer = new byte[dataLength];Di2015NewLine        var position = 0;Di2015NewLine        while ((bytesRead = ServerSocket.Receive(buffer, position, buffer.Length - position, SocketFlags.None)) > 0)Di2015NewLine        {Di2015NewLine            // Advance the position by the number of bytes readDi2015NewLine            position += bytesRead;Di2015NewLine            // If there's still more data to read before we have a full message, call Receive againDi2015NewLine            if (position < buffer.Length) continue;Di2015NewLine            // We have a complete message - return it.Di2015NewLine            return Encoding.UTF8.GetString(buffer);Di2015NewLine        }Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine    // If Receive returns 0, the socket has been closed, so return null to indicate this.Di2015NewLine    return null;Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine
11007448Di2015UniqueSeparatorStopwatch stopWatch = new Stopwatch();Di2015NewLinestopWatch.Start();Di2015NewLineThread.Sleep(10000);Di2015NewLinestopWatch.Stop();Di2015NewLine// Get the elapsed time as a TimeSpan value.Di2015NewLineTimeSpan ts = stopWatch.Elapsed;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine// Format and display the TimeSpan value.Di2015NewLinestring elapsedTime = String.Format("{0:00}:{1:00}:{2:00}.{3:00}",Di2015NewLine    ts.Hours, ts.Minutes, ts.Seconds,Di2015NewLine    ts.Milliseconds / 10);Di2015NewLineConsole.WriteLine("RunTime " + elapsedTime);Di2015NewLine

11009999Di2015UniqueSeparator//NOTE: this is just a sample, not a suggestion to do it in such wayDi2015NewLineDi2015NewLinepublic interface IDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    void F();Di2015NewLine    void G();Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLinepublic static class ADi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    public static void F() { System.Console.WriteLine("A: doing F()"); }Di2015NewLine    public static void G() { System.Console.WriteLine("A: doing G()"); }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLinepublic static class BDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    public static void F() { System.Console.WriteLine("B: doing F()"); }Di2015NewLine    public static void G() { System.Console.WriteLine("B: doing G()"); }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLinepublic class C : IDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    // delegation Di2015NewLine    Action iF = A.F;Di2015NewLine    Action iG = A.G;Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    public void F() { iF(); }Di2015NewLine    public void G() { iG(); }Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLine    // normal attributesDi2015NewLine    public void ToA() { iF = A.F; iG = A.G; }Di2015NewLine    public void ToB() { iF = B.F; iG = B.G; }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLineDi2015NewLinepublic class ProgramDi2015NewLine{Di2015NewLine    public static void Main()Di2015NewLine    {Di2015NewLine        C c = new C();Di2015NewLine        c.F();     // output: A: doing F()Di2015NewLine        c.G();     // output: A: doing G()Di2015NewLine        c.ToB();Di2015NewLine        c.F();     // output: B: doing F()Di2015NewLine        c.G();     // output: B: doing G()Di2015NewLine    }Di2015NewLine}Di2015NewLine
